function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Introduction of gene drive mosquitoes could lead to unintended consequences in the ecosystem, such as the decline of other species or the emergence of new diseases.","Impact":"Uncontrolled spread of gene drive mosquitoes could disrupt the natural balance of the ecosystem and increase the risk of new disease outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Thorough ecological impact assessments and strict regulatory frameworks should be established before releasing gene drive mosquitoes into the environment.","Technologies":"Ecological modeling, genetic containment technologies, and regulatory oversight.","People":"Local communities, wildlife, and public health.","Owner":"Environmental agencies, research institutions, and government regulators."},{"Description":"Release of Wolbachia-carrying mosquitoes could unintentionally introduce new pathogens or disrupt the balance of existing microbial communities in the environment.","Impact":"Uncontrolled spread of Wolbachia-carrying mosquitoes may lead to the spread of new diseases or ecosystem imbalances.","Mitigation":"Comprehensive risk assessments, monitoring of microbial communities, and strict containment measures should be in place before widespread release of Wolbachia-carrying mosquitoes.","Technologies":"Microbiome analysis, microbial containment measures, and ecological monitoring.","People":"Local communities, wildlife, and public health.","Owner":"Environmental agencies, research institutions, and government regulators."},{"Description":"The use of spatial repellents in combating vector-borne diseases could lead to the development of resistance in mosquito populations, rendering the repellents ineffective.","Impact":"Resistance to spatial repellents could reduce their efficacy, leading to increased exposure to disease-carrying mosquitoes.","Mitigation":"Rotation of different types of spatial repellents, development of novel repellent formulations, and surveillance of mosquito populations for resistance.","Technologies":"Repellent efficacy studies, formulation development, and mosquito resistance monitoring.","People":"Public health practitioners, researchers, and communities at risk of vector-borne diseases.","Owner":"Public health agencies, research institutions, and industry partners."}]}
